page.title: 09Markets-local,UK and EEC
page.content: The farming in this area is concerned with 2 main products- ARABLE- cereals used for biscuits and breakfast cereals and distributed nationally & internationally.LIVESTOCK-mainly wool, meat and milk.in one case,2/3 of the milk went to London by rail & 1/3 to Cheltenham.There is some variation in markets for the products.Any meat or livestock are taken to markets in the Midlands or locally eg Gloucester Cirencester & Andoversford.All eggs go to Cheltenham or locally. The EEC has had an effect on trade with a cut-back on cows because of overproduction of milk and butter and an increase in cereal production. Over the past 40 years there has been a continuous pattern of change and this should be seen as the most recent part of it .EEC bureaucracy is disliked.
